intro: Hieracium subaroelli, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, and its stems are upright with few branches. Hieracium subaroelli is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
